docs.lead_paragraph: Bernard Lagat won the 102nd Millrose Games’ Wanamaker Mile in 3 minutes 58.44 seconds, tying Eamonn Coghlan’s record of seven titles.

headline.seo: Bernard Lagat Wins Mile at Millrose, Tying Record
headline.main: Lagat Wins Mile at Millrose, Tying Coghlan’s Record
headline.print_headline: Lagat Wins Mile at Millrose, Tying Coghlan’s Record

docs.snippet: Bernard Lagat won the 102nd Millrose Games’ Wanamaker Mile in 3 minutes 58.44 seconds, tying Eamonn Coghlan’s record of seven titles.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the wake of a news story about President Kgalema Motlanthe’s multiple alleged paramours, South Africans are weighing a public official’s right to privacy.

headline.main: South African Leader’s Sex Life Stirs Salacious Gossip and Privacy Debate
headline.print_headline: South African Leader’s Sex Life Stirs Salacious Gossip and Privacy Debate

docs.snippet: In the wake of a news story about President Kgalema Motlanthe’s multiple alleged paramours, South Africans are weighing a public official’s right to privacy.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a journalism conference a couple of years ago, I met Linda Perlstein, the author of "Not Much Just Chillin': The Hidden Lives of Middle Schoolers." This meeting occurred right in the middle of the "rainbow party" craze - that is to say, the media frenzy around the alleged oral activities of oversexed (and lipsticked) tweens.
docs.abstract: The notion that teenagers are engaging in too much sex is just another myth that adults like to believe about children, Judith Warner writes, because it enables them to ignore real problems.
docs.snippet: The notion that teenagers are engaging in too much sex is just another myth that adults like to believe about children, Judith Warner writes, because it enables them to ignore real problems.
